radiographic_examinations.findings: Prolonged QTc interval of 600 ms and polymorphic ventricular tachyarrhythmias documented.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, sinus rhythm with normal QTc interval of 410 ms was noted on day 1, followed by marked QTc prolongation on day 5.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Documented T-wave alternans and increased QT dispersion.
Recorded fatal nonterminating tachyarrhythmia with heart rate of 300 bpm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrent bradycardias with heart rate of 60 bpm were documented before the lethal event.
